page.title: 06 SPORT
page.content: {MORPETH RUGBY CLUB}was originally for King Ed.VI "Old Boys" and played at the Grammar School.The first secretary was Mr. George Howell who introduced rugby to Morpeth.In 1954 the club moved to{Grange House Field,} shared with Morpeth Harriers.Here they have two pitches.With 6 senior teams and a colt team, they can play 4 home games most Saturdays.The new club house and squash courts were opened in 1975.{MORPETH HARRIERS and ATHLETICS {CLUB,}originally a football club, was started in 1947 at the Greyhound Inn by Messrs.D Anderson and E.Slaughter. Now with over 400 members, they compete in all track and field events. {THE DRY SKI SLOPE}was made in 1971 by Northumberland L.E.A. and K.E.VI School.The slope is used by all schools north of the Tyne.Handicapped children are provided with short skis.
